member.name: T:BytecodeApi.UITreeType

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ElevationType
member.summary: Specifies the elevation type for a Windows user.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ElevationType.Default
member.summary: The token does not have a linked token (standard user, elevation requires credentials from an administrative user account).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ElevationType.Full
member.summary: The token is an elevated token (integrity level is high or above).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ElevationType.Limited
member.summary: The token is a limited token (integrity level is medium, but the user is a local administrator and can elevate with consent).

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat
member.summary: Specifies the display format for byte size values to be used in formatting logic.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat.ByteSize
member.summary:
Specifies that the closest unit (Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, ...) is displayed. The result is rounded with no decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat.ByteSizeTwoDigits
member.summary:
Specifies that the closest unit (Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, ...) is displayed. The result is rounded with two decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12,06 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat.Bytes
member.summary:
Specifies that the exact amount of bytes is displayed. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12.345 bytes"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat.KiloBytes
member.summary:
Specifies that the value is displayed as kilobytes. The result is rounded up. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "13 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat.KiloBytesTwoDigits
member.summary:
Specifies that the value is displayed as kilobytes. The result is rounded with two decimal places. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "13 KB"

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming
member.summary: Specifies the naming convention of a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming.CSharp
member.summary:
The namespace is omitted and the C# type name is used for built-in types.
Examples: int, DateTime

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming.TypeName
member.summary:
The namespace is omitted and the .NET Framework type name is used.
Examples: Int32, DateTime

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming.FullName
member.summary:
The full type name including namespace is used.
Examples: System.Int32, System.DateTime

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.AngleType.Gradians
member.summary: The angle is measured in gradians.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.DateTimePart.DateTimeWithSeconds
member.summary: The date and time including seconds of the object is used.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.DateTimePart.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time excluding seconds of the object is used.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.DateTimePart.Date
member.summary: The date part excluding time information of the object is used. This is equal to the property.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.DateTimePart.YearMonth
member.summary: The year and month of the object is used. is set to 1.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.DateTimePart.Year
member.summary: The year is used. and are both set to 1.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ExitProcessMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method in which the current is terminated.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ExitProcessMethod.ExitProcess
member.summary: Specifies termination using , passing 0 as exit code.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ExitProcessMethod.KillProcess
member.summary: Specifies termination using .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ExitProcessMethod.StackOverflow
member.summary: Specifies termination by causing a stack overflow. The current will crash, exceptions cannot be handled.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format for a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Default
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits.
Example: 00000000000000000000000000000000

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Hyphens
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens.
Example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Braces
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces.
Example: {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Parentheses
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses.
Example: (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Hexadecimal
member.summary:
The is displayed with four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces.
Example: {0x00000000,0x0000,0x0000,{0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00}}

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.HashType
member.summary: Specifies a hash algorithm.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.Adler32
member.summary:
The Adler-32 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "00000001".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.CRC32
member.summary:
The CRC32 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "00000000".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.CRC64
member.summary:
The CRC64 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "0000000000000000".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.MD5
member.summary:
The MD5 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.RIPEMD160
member.summary:
The RIPEMD-160 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "9c1185a5c5e9fc54612808977ee8f548b2258d31".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA1
member.summary:
The SHA-1 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "da39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA256
member.summary:
The SHA-256 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA384
member.summary:
The SHA-384 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "38b060a751ac96384cd9327eb1b1e36a21fdb71114be07434c0cc7bf63f6e1da274edebfe76f65fbd51ad2f14898b95b".

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.HashType.SHA512
member.summary:
The SHA-512 algorithm is used.
A hashed by this algorithm will return "cf83e1357eefb8bdf1542850d66d8007d620e4050b5715dc83f4a921d36ce9ce47d0d13c5d85f2b0ff8318d2877eec2f63b931bd47417a81a538327af927da3e".

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ProcessAnalyzer
member.summary: Specifies a process analyzer, such as a sandbox, a virtual environment, or a running program.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessAnalyzer.Sandboxie
member.summary:
Specifies Sandboxie
Detection: The module 'SbieDll.dll' is loaded.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessAnalyzer.Emulator
member.summary:
Specifies a generic emulator
Detection: A sleep of 500 milliseconds is measured. If it is below 450 milliseconds, an emulator is detected.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessAnalyzer.Wireshark
member.summary:
Specifies that Wireshark is currently running.
Detection: Either 'Wireshark.exe' is running in any active user session, or a window with the title 'The Wireshark Network Analyzer' is opened.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessAnalyzer.ProcessMonitor
member.summary:
Specifies that Process Monitor is currently running.
Detection: A window with a title that starts with 'Process Monitor -' is opened.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ProcessIntegrityLevel
member.summary: Specifies the mandatory integrity level for a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessIntegrityLevel.Untrusted
member.summary: The is running with untrusted integrity (SECURITY_MANDATORY_UNTRUSTED_RID).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessIntegrityLevel.Low
member.summary: The is running with low integrity (SECURITY_MANDATORY_LOW_RID).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessIntegrityLevel.Medium
member.summary: The is running with medium integrity (SECURITY_MANDATORY_MEDIUM_RID or SECURITY_MANDATORY_MEDIUM_PLUS_RID).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessIntegrityLevel.High
member.summary: The is running with high integrity (SECURITY_MANDATORY_HIGH_RID).

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ProcessIntegrityLevel.System
member.summary: The is running with system integrity (SECURITY_MANDATORY_SYSTEM_RID).

member.summary:
The is lowercase.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.Upper
member.summary:
The is uppercase.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.CamelCase
member.summary:

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.DateTimeExtensions.AddBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that adds the specified number of business days to this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are added, otherwise days are subtracted.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be added to this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the sum of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.DateTimeExtensions.SubtractBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that subtracts the specified number of business days from this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are subtracted, otherwise days are added.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be subtracted from this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the difference of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.DateTimeExtensions.GetTotalBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Computes the total count of business days between two instances. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The time fraction is ignored and the returned value is inclusive.
Example 1: Friday through Tuesday = 3 business days
Example 2: Saturday through Sunday = 0 business days
member.param: The value to compare to .
The value to compare to this . can be either less or greater than this value.
member.returns: A value representing the total count of business days between two instances.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.CsvFile.DetectDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to detect the delimiter of a CSV file and returns a indicating the delimiter, or , if it could not be detected. For detection, a specified number of rows is tested for various delimiters. By default, a minimum of 2 rows is required and up to 10 rows are tested. The tested delimiters are ",", ";", "\t" and "|". If all rows have the same column count and the column count is greater than 1, the tested delimiter is considered correct.
member.param: A representing the path to a flat file database, such as a CSV file.
member.returns: The detected delimiter, or , if no definite delimiter was detected.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.CsvFile.DetectDelimiter(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Tries to detect the delimiter of a CSV file and returns a indicating the delimiter, or , if it could not be detected. For detection, a specified number of rows is tested for various delimiters. By default, a minimum of 2 rows is required and up to 10 rows are tested. The tested delimiters are ",", ";", "\t" and "|". If all rows have the same column count and the column count is greater than 1, the tested delimiter is considered correct.
member.param: A representing the path to a flat file database, such as a CSV file.
The encoding to use if encoding is not determined from the file. Specify to detect encoding automatically or provide a value to explicitly parse with a specific .
member.returns: The detected delimiter, or , if no definite delimiter was detected.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.CsvFile.DetectDelimiter(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Tries to detect the delimiter of a CSV file and returns a indicating the delimiter, or , if it could not be detected. For detection, a specified number of rows is tested for various delimiters. By default, a minimum of 2 rows is required and up to 10 rows are tested. The tested delimiters are ",", ";", "\t" and "|". If all rows have the same column count and the column count is greater than 1, the tested delimiter is considered correct.
member.param: A representing the path to a flat file database, such as a CSV file.
The encoding to use if encoding is not determined from the file. Specify to detect encoding automatically or provide a value to explicitly parse with a specific .
A value specifying the minimum number of rows that the CSV file must have. The default value is 2.
A value specifying the maximum number of rows that will be tested. If the file has less rows, the complete file is tested. The default value is 10.
A [] specifying the delimiters to test for in the specified order. By default, ",", ";", "\t" and "|" are tested.
member.returns: The detected delimiter, or , if no definite delimiter was detected.

member.param: The [] that represents a flat file database to read from.
member.returns: The detected delimiter, or , if no definite delimiter was detected.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Compression.Compress(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Compresses the specified [] using GZip and returns a new [] that can be used with the method. The resulting binary is proprietary and specific to the class.
member.param: A [] that represents data to be compressed.
member.returns: A new [] that can be used with the method. The resulting binary is proprietary and specific to the class.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Compression.Decompress(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decompresses the specified [] using GZip and returns a new [] that represents the uncompressed data. The binary in the parameter is proprietary and specific to the class.
member.param: A [] that represents data compressed by the method.
member.returns: A new [] that represents the uncompressed data. The binary in the parameter is proprietary and specific to the class.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator
member.summary: Represents a performance counter for progress calculations, typically binary transfers (file transferring, downloads, ...)

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating the total progress. This is typically the amount of transferred bytes in a binary transfer operation.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the expected maximum value. This is typically the total size in bytes in a binary transfer operation. If is , values calculated based on it will also be . This is useful for display of an indeterminate status of progress bars.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.MeasureTimeSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval in which is measured. The event is raised in the approximate interval of this value, however only after has changed.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Progress
member.summary: Gets a ? value indicating the progress. This value is between 0.0 and 1.0, if is in bounds of 0.0 and .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.ProgressPercentage
member.summary: Gets a ? value indicating the progress in percent. This value is between 0.0 and 100.0, if is in bounds of 0.0 and .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Difference
member.summary: Gets the difference of the property between the last two measurements.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.DifferencePerSecond
member.summary: Gets the difference of the property between the last two measurements, interpolated to one second based on .

member.name: E:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the property changed.

member.name: E:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.Measured
member.summary: Occurs when the property changed and the interval specified in has been reached.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with no maximum value and a measurement interval of 1 second.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified maximum value and a measurement interval of 1 second.
member.param: A value indicating the maximum expected value for .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified maximum value and the specified measurement interval.
member.param: A value indicating the maximum expected value for .
A value indicating the interval in which to measure the progress.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.OnValueChanged
member.summary: Raises the event.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.ProgressCalculator.OnMeasured
member.summary: Raises the event.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.FileIcon
member.summary: Helper class to retrieve file icons from the resources of BytecodeApi.dll. The file icons are pre-defined images and limited to a fixed amount of known file extensions.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.AllIcons
member.summary: Gets all objects from the resources of BytecodeApi.dll. The resources are loaded the first time this property is accessed, or once an icon file is retrieved using the methods of this class.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Extension
member.summary: Gets the extension, without a dot, that identifies this icon.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon
member.summary: Gets the combined icon containing all sizes (16, 32 and 48).

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon16
member.summary: Gets the 16x16 pixel frame from .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon32
member.summary: Gets the 32x32 pixel frame from .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon48
member.summary: Gets the 48x48 pixel frame from .

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon16ImageSource
member.summary: Gets a managed , based on the property.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon32ImageSource
member.summary: Gets a managed , based on the property.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Icon48ImageSource
member.summary: Gets a managed , based on the property.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.FromExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a from the resources of BytecodeApi.dll, if the specified extension is known.
member.param: A value specifying the file extension, which is case insensitive and does not require a leading dot character.
member.returns: A object containing image objects for the specified extension.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified extension is known and exists in the resources of BytecodeApi.dll.
member.param: A value specifying the file extension, which is case insensitive and does not require a leading dot character.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the specified extension is known and exists in the resources of BytecodeApi.dll.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.GetIcon(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a specific frame from . The parameter must be 16, 32 or 48.
member.param: A value representing the size of the frame to retrieve. The value must be 16, 32 or 48.
member.returns: The frame from , specified by .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.FileIcon.GetIconImageSource(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a managed , based on the specific frame from . The parameter must be 16, 32 or 48.
member.param: A value representing the size of the frame to retrieve. The value must be 16, 32 or 48.
member.returns: A managed , based on the frame from , specified by .

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates a random text sequence that match the pattern of real language. A is used to generate the sentences that generated text are composed of.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.SentenceGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used to generate sentences.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.MinSentenceCount
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum number sentences used to build text.
The default value is 10

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.MaxSentenceCount
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number sentences used to build text.
The default value is 20

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.LineBreakChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a linebreak being inserted after a sentence, where 0.0f means no linebreaks and 1.0f means a linebreak between every sentence.
The default value is 0.0f

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.ParagraphChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a paragraph being inserted after a sentence, where 0.0f means no paragraphs and 1.0f means a paragraph between every sentence. Randomly picked paragraphs have precedence over linebreaks and do not occur consecutively.
The default value is 0.1f

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values ( = 10, = 20, = 0.0f, = 0.1f) and creates a new with default values.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.#ctor(BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified and with default values ( = 10, = 20, = 0.0f, = 0.1f).
member.param: The to use for sentence generation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.TextGenerator.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random sequence of sentences using the specified parameters of this instance.
member.returns: A new with dynamically generated text.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates random sentences that match the pattern of real language. A is used to generate the words that generated sentences are composed of.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.WordGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used to generate words.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.MinWords
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum number words used to build sentences.
The default value is 3

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.MaxWords
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number words used to build sentences.
The default value is 10

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.CommaChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a comma being inserted after a word, where 0.0f means no commas and 1.0f means a comma between every word.
The default value is 0.2f

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.FinishPunctuation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the characters that are used for punctuation after a sentence. Including a character multiple times increases the chance for this character. For example, this can be used to increase the likelihood of a period over a question mark or exclamation mark. Character order is not relevant.
The default value is "...?!"

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values ( = 3, = 10, = 0.2f, = "...?!") and creates a new with default values.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.#ctor(BytecodeApi.WordGenerator)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified and with default values ( = 3, = 10, = 0.2f, = "...?!").
member.param: The to use for word generation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.SentenceGenerator.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random sentence using the specified parameters of this instance.
member.returns: A new with a dynamically generated sentence.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates random words that match the pattern of real language. Word generation is typically used to create arbitrary text that looks like language.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.MinLength
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum length of a generated word.
The default value is 3

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.MaxLength
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum length of a generated word.
The default value is 10

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.DoubleConsonantChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a consonant being inserted twice, where 0.0f means no double consonants and 1.0f means consonants are always inserted twice.
The default value is 0.1f

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.DoubleVovelChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a vovel being inserted twice, where 0.0f means no double vovels and 1.0f means vovels are always inserted twice.
The default value is 0.1f

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values ( = 3, = 10, = 0.1f, = 0.1f).

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random word in CamelCase character casing using the specified parameters of this instance.
member.returns: A new with a dynamically generated word in CamelCase character casing.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.WordGenerator.Generate(BytecodeApi.StringCasing)
member.summary: Generates a random word in the specified using the specified parameters of this instance.
member.param: The to be used for characters in the generated word.
member.returns: A new with a dynamically generated word in the specified .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.TrimText(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Trims the specified by the specified length. If the is longer than the value of , it will be truncated by a leading "..." to match the parameter, including the length of the "..." appendix (3 characters).
member.param: The to be trimmed.
A value specifying the maximum length of the returned string.
member.returns: The original value of , if the length of the is less than or equal to the parameter; otherwise, the truncated and a leading "..." that matches the parameter, including the length of the "..." appendix (3 characters).

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.TrimText(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)

member.param: The to be trimmed.
A value specifying the maximum length of the returned string.
The trailing text.
member.returns: The original value of , if the length of the is less than or equal to the parameter and the length of the parameter; otherwise, the truncated and the value of that matches the parameter, including the length of the paramter.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.JoinStrings(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary:
Concatenates all values in the specified collection, where is used for the last separator.
Example with 1 value: A
Example with 2 values: A and B
Example with 3 values: A, B and C
Example with 4 values: A, B, C and D
member.param: A value specifying the separator between each value.
A value specifying the separator between the last two values.
The [] that is concatenated.
member.returns: A , where the values of is concatenated by the specified separators, or , if the collection is empty.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.PluralizeString(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pluralizes the specified by appending "s", if is not equal to 1.
member.param: The value to be pluralized.
A value representing a count number. If this value is not equal to 1, is pluralized.
member.returns: The pluralized representation of the specified .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.FormatByteSizeString(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Formats a value representing a byte size in the format.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12,06 KB"
member.param: A value representing a byte size.
member.returns: An equivalent value representing the byte size value in the format.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.FormatByteSizeString(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Formats a value representing a byte size with the specified number of decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12,06 KB" (given, that = 2)
member.param: A value representing a byte size.
The number of decimal places to round the result to.
member.returns: An equivalent value representing the formatted byte size value.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.FormatByteSizeString(System.Int64,BytecodeApi.ByteSizeFormat)
member.summary: Formats a value representing a byte size in the specified and returns its equivalent representation.
member.param: A value representing a byte size.
The to use to format .
member.returns: An equivalent value representing the byte size value in the specified .

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.FormatTimeSpanString(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Converts the value of the specified to a human readable representation by displaying the two most significant elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds that are greater than zero, separated by a comma.
Example: "12:00:03" is converted to "12h, 3s"
member.param: The value to convert.
member.returns: The value of the specified as a human readable representation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.FormatTimeSpanString(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Converts the value of the specified to a human readable representation by displaying a specified number of most significant elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds that are greater than zero, separated by a comma.
Example: "5.03:30:15" is converted to "5d, 3h", if is 2 and "5d, 3h, 30m", if is 3.
member.param: The value to convert.
A value specifying the number of elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds to display.
member.returns: The value of the specified as a human readable representation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Wording.FormatTimeSpanString(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Converts the value of the specified to a human readable representation by displaying a specified number of most significant elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds that are greater than zero, separated by the specified separator.
Example: "5.03:30:15" is converted to "5d, 3h", if is 2 and "5d, 3h, 30m", if is 3.
member.param: The value to convert.
A value specifying the number of elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds to display.
A specifying the separator to use between each element, including whitespaces, if needed.
member.returns: The value of the specified as a human readable representation.

to use the warning icon; to use the information icon.
